subject: Cybersecurity
title: Kevin Poulsen and the Radio Station Hack
description: A quick win: understand Kevin Poulsen and the Radio Station Hack.

hook.text: A hacker rigged a radio station's phone lines to guarantee he'd be the 102nd caller and win a Porsche.

buildup.text: Kevin Poulsen took over all 25 phone lines of KIIS-FM Los Angeles in 1990, blocking every other caller.

discovery.text: He won the Porsche 944, plus $20,000 in cash and two trips â€” all by controlling the phone system.

twist.text: Poulsen was already wanted by the FBI for hacking military systems. The radio stunt helped them catch him.

climax.text: After prison, Poulsen became a respected journalist and built SecureDrop for whistleblowers.

punchline.text: He hacked his way to a Porsche, then hacked his way to redemption.

quiz.question: What did Kevin Poulsen win by hacking a radio station?
